meanings.definition: Automorphisms: transformations of an object that preserve its structure
meanings.sent1: The automorphisms of the puzzle kept its original shape.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians study automorphisms to understand how objects can be transformed while maintaining their structure.
meanings.sent3: The automorphisms of the Rubik's cube made it impossible to solve!
meanings.sent4: The automorphisms of the building turned it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The automorphisms of the crystal clear water reflected the beauty of the surroundings.

meanings.definition: Automorphisms: self-mappings of a mathematical object that preserve its properties
meanings.sent1: The automorphisms of the equation ensured its solutions remained the same.
meanings.sent2: Understanding automorphisms helps mathematicians analyze the properties of mathematical objects.
meanings.sent3: The automorphisms of the number line decided to throw a party!
meanings.sent4: The automorphisms of the function painted a colorful picture of mathematical consistency.
meanings.sent5: The automorphisms of the geometric shape maintained its symmetry and angles perfectly.
